snippet: What would you name a new element on the periodic table? Scientists will soon have to decide. New York Times readers had some suggestions.
abstract: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry is preparing to rename four superheavy elements on periodic table, currently identified only as 113, 115, 117 and 118; reader suggestions for new identifiers highlighted.
lead_paragraph: What would you name a new element on the periodic table? Scientists will soon have to decide. New York Times readers had some suggestions.

headline.main: Godzillium vs. Trumpium: Some Suggestions to Add to the Periodic Table
headline.print_headline: Godzillium vs. Trumpium: What to Call New Elements?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry
